property.name: text
property.value:
The roller plus paper is a cylinder of initial radius R and initial mass M. We assume the roller mass includes the mass of the drive motor armature.
The actual radius Q = R(1-delta*theta/(2*pi)) where theta is angle and delta is paper thickness. The mass is m=Mo(Q^2/R^2)
Moment of inertial J = mass*Q^2 = MoQ^4/R^2 in kgm^2/s^2
theta = integral of omega
The dc motor-roller dynamics are given by the transfer function: omega/V = K/{(Js +b)(Ls_R) +K^2} where: omega is the angularVelocity V in the input voltage K is the eletromotive force constant (Nm/Amp) J is the moment of iertia b is the damping ration in Nms R is the armature resistance in ohms L is the inductance in henrys
The velocity of the paper is that of a point on the surface of the roller, namely paperVelocity = angularVelocity*pi*2*R where the angularVelocity = integral of angularAcceleration. It is assumed that the paper does NOT slip while travelling over the roller.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the moment of inertia j in kg*m^2/s^2 given the radius of the roller, coreRadius, in meters, the mass of the roller, massOfRoller, in kg, including the motor armature, coreMass, in kg.
The formula is:
J= coreMass*coreRadius^2/2

property.name: text
property.value: This actor models the controller circuit board and the controller microprocessor. The board models the ADC and the network NIC and PHY.

property.name: text
property.value:
The controller is a PID controller that minimizes the error signal which is the difference between the target velocity profile and the measured velocity.
The register actor is required since the sensor sampling is not necessarily at the same frequency as the frequency of receipt of profile information.

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

property.name: text
property.value:
The feedRoller is a cylinder of radius coreRadius with the paper of thickness delta extending to a radius actualRollRadius which for a full roll is fullRollRadius.
The actual radius Q = R(1-delta*theta/(2*pi)) where theta is roller angle.
theta = integral of omega
The dc motor-roller dynamics are given by the transfer function: omega/V = K/{(Js +b)(Ls - R) +K^2} where: omega is the angularVelocity V in the input voltage K is the eletromotive force constant (Nm/Amp) J is the moment of iertia b is the damping ration in Nms R is the armature resistance in ohms L is the inductance in henrys
The resulting equation to be solved is: d^2(omega)/(dt)^2 = KV/(LJ) -(R/L +b/J)*d(omega)/dt - (b*R + K^2)*omega/(JL)
The velocity of the paper is that of a point on the surface of the roller, namely paperVelocity = (d(omega)/dt)*pi*2*R It is assumed that the paper does NOT slip while travelling over the roller.

property.name: text
property.value:
The actor computes the current radius (in meters) of the remaining paper on the roller. The initial radius is initialRadius which is decreased by the paper thickness, paperThickness, (in meters)every revolution of the roller. The number of revolutions since start is given by theta, the roller angle in radians divided by 2 pi.
If only Q% of the initial paper mass remains on the roll, the initialRadius is given by:
initialRadius = sqrt{ coreRadius^2 + (Q/100)*(fullRollRadius^2 - coreRadius^2)
Once the paper radius = coreRadius it remains there (e.g. paper does not reappear even if theta oscillates due to shutdown of the roller).

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the moment of inertia j in kg*m^2/s^2 given the radius of the paper on the roller, paperRadius, in meters, the mass of the paper on a full roll, massOfFullRoll, in kg, the radius of a full roll, fullRollRadius, in meters, the radius of the inner core, coreRadius, in meters and the mass of the inner core including the motor armature, coreMass, in kg.
The formula is:
J= (coreMass*coreRadius^2)/2 + massOfFullRoll*(paperRadius^4 - coreRadius^4)/[2*(fullRollRadius^2 - coreRadius^2)]

property.name: text
property.value: This actor models the controller circuit board and the controller microprocessor. The board models the ADC and the network NIC and PHY.

property.name: text
property.value: 1 causes const 0 to be used as the input

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

property.name: text
property.value: This actor produces a ramp starting at time 0 with value 0, ramping to a constant value of maxPaperVelocity at time 350 when the actor boolean parameter ramp is true. When false the actor produces a step funtion with final value maxPaperVelocity at time 0.5.

property.name: text
property.value: This actor produces a ramp starting at time 0 with value 0, ramping to a constant value of maxPaperVelocity at time 350 when the actor boolean parameter ramp is true. When false the actor produces a step funtion with final value maxPaperVelocity at time 0.5.

property.name: text
property.value:
The feedRoller is a cylinder of radius coreRadius with the paper of thickness delta extending to a radius actualRollRadius which for a full roll is fullRollRadius.
The actual radius Q = R(1-delta*theta/(2*pi)) where theta is roller angle.
theta = integral of omega
The dc motor-roller dynamics are given by the transfer function: omega/V = K/{(Js +b)(Ls - R) +K^2} where: omega is the angularVelocity V in the input voltage K is the eletromotive force constant (Nm/Amp) J is the moment of iertia b is the damping ration in Nms R is the armature resistance in ohms L is the inductance in henrys
The resulting equation to be solved is: d^2(omega)/(dt)^2 = KV/(LJ) -(R/L +b/J)*d(omega)/dt - (b*R + K^2)*omega/(JL)
The velocity of the paper is that of a point on the surface of the roller, namely paperVelocity = (d(omega)/dt)*pi*2*R It is assumed that the paper does NOT slip while travelling over the roller.

property.name: text
property.value:
The actor computes the current radius (in meters) of the remaining paper on the roller. The initial radius is initialRadius which is decreased by the paper thickness, paperThickness, (in meters)every revolution of the roller after receipt of a signal contact = 1. The number of revolutions since start is given by theta, the roller angle in radians divided by 2 pi. theta is the integral of omega the roller angular velocity.The paper does not start to unwind until contact is true.
If only percentFullRoll% of the initial paper mass remains on the roll, the initialRadius is given by:
initialRadius = sqrt{ coreRadius^2 + (percentFullRoll/100)*(fullRollRadius^2 - coreRadius^2)
Once the radius reaches coreRadius it remains there even if the input theta oscillates due to transients.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the moment of inertia j in kg*m^2/s^2 given the radius of the paper on the roller, paperRadius, in meters, the mass of the paper on a full roll, massOfFullRoll, in kg, the radius of a full roll, fullRollRadius, in meters, the radius of the inner core, coreRadius, in meters and the mass of the inner core including the motor armature, coreMass, in kg.
The formula is:
J= (coreMass*coreRadius^2)/2 + massOfFullRoll*(paperRadius^4 - coreRadius^4)/[2*(fullRollRadius^2 - coreRadius^2)]

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor models a detector that senses the amount of paper remaining on the fee roller and sends a signal 'startReserve' at the point that allows the reserve feed to come up to speed and for contact to be made such that a minimal amount of waste paper is left on the feed roller. The signal armContact is sent when armLength meter of paper is left on the feed.
For present purposes startReserve is set via a startReserveTime parameter. startReserveTime>= remainingTime = (length remaining)/maxPaperVelocity = 2*pi(currentRadius-coreRadius)^2/(paperThickness*maxPaperVelocity)
armContact is set via a armLength parameter. time of armContact occurs when: armLength ~>= 2*pi*coreRadius(currentRadius-coreRadius)/(paperThickness)

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

property.value: This actor models the controller circuit board and the controller microprocessor. The board models the ADC and the network NIC and PHY.

property.name: text
property.value: 1 causes const 0 to be used as the input

property.name: text
property.value: This actor produces a ramp starting at time 0 with value 0, ramping to a constant value of maxPaperVelocity at time 350 when the actor boolean parameter ramp is true. When false the actor produces a step funtion with final value maxPaperVelocity at time 0.5.
